Label: occupies
Definition: An organization occupies a geographical location is it has one of more people at the location, or has legal rights to the location
Example: The Navaho Nation occupies the Navaho Nation reservation.  Microsoft occupies a campus in Redmond Washington.  The University of Pittsburg occupies the

Label: has occurent part
Definition: A has part relation that applies only to occurents
Example: The project to put a man on the man achieved success on July 20, 1969
Editors Note: The inverse of RO_2012 and should be defined in RO.  Defined here for convenience since it is missing from RO.

Label: has time instant
Definition: The property that associates a process boundary with the time instant at which the process boundary occurs
Example: Duraspace was dissolved (a process boundary) in 2019 (a time instant with an XSDdatetimestamp and a year precision)
Editors Note: This provides a bidge between BFO ontologies and the W3C time ontology

Label: has organizational interest
Definition: The property that associates an organization with a concept that the organization manifests in its work.
Example: LYRASIS has organizational interest open source software.  The New York Yankees Baseball Club has organizational interest baseball.  The Gettysburg Foundation has organizational interest The Battle of Gettysburg.
Editors Note: Additional subproperties could provide insight regarding the nature of the interest such as research interest, commercial interest, and so on

Label: has website
Definition: The property that associates an organization with its website
Example: LYRASIS has website https://lyrasis.org.  Moscow State University has website https://msu.ru

Label: website of
Definition: The property that associates a website with its organization.
Example: The website https://vivoweb.org website of The VIVO Project

Label: has successor organization
Definition: The property that associates an organization with the organization that succeeds it.  The preceeding organization ceases to exist, the successor is brought into existence.
Example: The United Colonies has successor organization The United States of America

Label: successor organization of
Definition: The property that associates an on organization with the organization that preceeded it.
Example: The United Nations is the successor of the The League of Nations.

Label: has organizational part
Definition: The property that asserts an organization has an organization part
Example: The University of Florida has organizational part College of Medicine; The College of Medicine has organizational part Department of Anesthesiology

Label: organizational part of
Definition: The property that an organization part is part of an organization
Example: The College of Medicine at UF organizational part of UF; Department of Anethesiology at UF organizational part of College of Medicine at UF

Label: affiliated with
Definition: The property that associates an organization with another organization that is not an organizational part associatiion
Example: The Theatre Library Association is an affiliate of the American Library Association
Editors Note: Affiliate relationships exist in many different types of configurations across all sorts of industries.  This term has very broad semantics.

Label: has spin-off organization
Definition: The property that associates an organization with a part that is now independent
Example: Google is a spin-off company of Stanford University; AGTC is a spin-off company of the University of Florida
Editors Note: To say that a is a spin-off of b implies there is a spin-off process and that a is the output of that spin-off process

Label: spin-off organization of
Definition: The property that associates an organization with an organization of which it was formerly a part
Example: Open Clinical is a spin-off of Oxford University. ToposNomos Ltd. is a spin-off company of the University of Magdeburg

Label: has organizational member
Definition: The property that associates an organization with one of its members
Example: The EU has member Republic of Ireland
Editors Note: To say that on organizaton is a member of another implies there is a membership and that the two organizations each have  roles that

Label: organizational member of
Definition: The property that associates a member organizaiton with the organization of which it is a member
Example: The University of North Carolina is a member of the Southeast University Research Assciation
